questions.question:
const arr = [1, 2, 3]
arr.at()
questions.explanation: If no argument is given to the .at() method, the item at index 0 will be returned.

questions.question:
const arr = [1, 2, 3]
const arr2 = [4, 5, 6]
arr1.concat(arr2)
questions.explanation: The concat method creates a new array of the two arrays merged together.

questions.question:
const fruits = ['Banana', 'Orange', 'Apple', 'Mango'];
fruits.copyWithin(2, 0);
questions.explanation: The array.copyWithin(target, start, end) method will copy elements from the start to the target.
